text: it's a photoshoot guaranteed to take the
breath away
China's buoyant booming economy has seen
a splurge in wedding spending in recent
years and with it has come a rapid
change in tastes and customs the curse
is especially especially for us because
a lot of couples choose the original
styles but we wanna a special style for
us I think a LaGrant under water is more
beautiful for the couples I think yeah
if you can't afford time off work for
those special images then why not have
them taken on the job these photos of a
paramilitary police officer and his wife
recently went viral on the Chinese
internet unlike in the West couples have
their main set of photos taken well in
advance of the wedding and with more
than half a million registered wedding
photographers countrywide competition is
fierce in Shanghai alone there are
dozens of studios with the special tanks
needed for the underwater shots China
might not have invented the genre but
it's caught on fast as old traditions
are swamped by a flood of new money this
photo shoot is costing Lambie and YY
here a little more than three hundred US
dollars but with some 10 million Chinese
couples tying the knot each year that
spending soon adds up and the industry
today is worth an estimated 80 billion
US dollars that's more than the total
output of some european economies and
includes all wedding spending ceremonies
receptions and honeymoons for
photographers who want to hang on to
their share of it spotting the next new
trend may determine if they sink or swim
John Saad worth BBC News Shanghai
